Obtain estimates of rates, combined with original data

augment.BayesRates_results.Rd

Extract estimated rates from an object created by a call to smooth_age() or smooth_agetime(), and combine these with the original data.

Usage

# S3 method for class 'BayesRates_results'
augment(x, interval = 0.95, ...)

Arguments

x

A "BayesRates_results" object created by calling function smooth_age() or smooth_agetime().

interval

Width of credible intervals. A number between 0 and 1. Default is 0.95.

...

Not currently used.

Value

A tibble, constructed by merging nevent_df and py_df, and the creating six new columns:

  • <agevar>.mid: Midpoints of age groups (which is useful for plotting.)

  • .fitted: Point estimates (posterior medians) of rates.

  • .lower, .upper: Lower and upper bounds of credible intervals specified by interval.

  • .probability: A list column with all draws from the posterior distribution.

  • .observed: Direct estimates of rates.

Details

In addition to the modelled rates, augment() also displayed 'direct' estimates of rates. Direct estimates are estimates obtained by dividing events by populations at risk, with no smoothing.

See also

  • smooth_age() smooths rates over age.

  • smooth_agetime() smooths rates over age and time.

  • components() extracts rates, age effects, time effects, and hyper-parameters.

  • n_draw() sets the default number of draws from the posterior distribution.

  • total_rate() calculates a summary indicator.

Examples

results <- smooth_agetime(nevent_df = nz_divorces,
                          py_df = nz_population,
                          age_width_df = nz_age_width_df,
                          age_min = 15)
augment(results)
#> # A tibble: 660 × 11
#>    age    time sex    nevent     py age.mid .fitted  .lower  .upper .probability
#>    <fct> <int> <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> <list>
